decks.notes: The deck revolves around quickly playing big Eldrazi creatures by ramping with Eldrazi Temple and Ancient Tomb. It also disrupts opponents with Chalice of the Void and Thorn of Amethyst, while using Thought-Knot Seer to strip away important cards from their hand. The low curve of creatures allows for aggressive plays, backed up by removal like Dismember and Warping Wail. The deck aims to overwhelm opponents with big threats and disrupt their game plan, ultimately overpowering them with efficient Eldrazi creatures.

The deck focuses on efficiently assembling the Aluren combo to generate value and card advantage by casting creatures for free. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy using discard spells like Cabal Therapy and Thoughtseize while controlling the board with removal spells like Abrupt Decay. By using Shardless Agent and Imperial Recruiter to find combo pieces, the deck can quickly overwhelm the opponent with efficient creature recursion and draw spells like Brainstorm. With a mix of disruption, value engines, and combo potential, the deck aims to outmaneuver opponents and secure victory.

This UWx Control deck focuses on manipulating the top of your library and controlling the game through powerful card advantage and removal spells. Utilizing cards like Counterbalance, Sensei's Divining Top, Terminus, and Jace, the Mind Sculptor, you can control the board and disrupt your opponent's strategy. With a mix of counter spells, removal, and card selection, you can out-value your opponent and secure victory through efficient control of the game state. The inclusion of Entreat the Angels provides a win condition should the game go long, while cards like Vendilion Clique and Snapcaster Mage provide additional versatility and disruption.

The main concept of this deck is to disrupt your opponent's game plan while applying pressure with efficient creatures. By utilizing cards like Mother of Runes and Phyrexian Revoker to protect your threats, along with disruptive elements like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Spirit of the Labyrinth, you can slow down your opponent and control the pace of the game. Stoneforge Mystic helps you search for powerful equipment like Batterskull and Umezawa's Jitte to further enhance your board presence. With a focus on aggressive plays and disrupting your opponent's strategy, this deck aims to establish early dominance and close out games quickly.

The deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan while creating tempo and pressure with efficient creatures and disruptive spells. It uses cards like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Phyrexian Revoker to slow down the opponent's mana development, while utilizing cards like Flickerwisp and Stoneforge Mystic to generate value and apply pressure. The deck aims to control the board through land denial with cards like Wasteland and Rishadan Port, while also presenting a quick clock with creatures like Mirran Crusader and Serra Avenger. Ultimately, the deck seeks to out-tempo and out-value the opponent to secure a victory.

This deck relies on fast and aggressive Eldrazi creatures to overwhelm the opponent quickly. By utilizing cards like Eldrazi Mimic, Thought-Knot Seer, and Reality Smasher, the deck aims to put immense pressure on the opponent early in the game. Cards like Chalice of the Void and Wasteland help disrupt the opponent's game plan, while Umezawa's Jitte provides additional combat prowess. The deck is designed to capitalize on uncounterable creatures and powerful lands like Ancient Tomb and Eye of Ugin to establish dominance in the matchup.

This deck focuses on utilizing cheap and efficient spells, along with disruptive creatures, to maintain aggression and control over the opponent. By combining powerful threats like Tarmogoyf and Delver of Secrets with versatile spells like Brainstorm and Lightning Bolt, the deck aims to apply pressure while disrupting the opponent's game plan. With a strong mana base and a mix of countermagic, removal, and card selection, the deck can adapt to various matchups and strategies, making it a versatile and powerful force in Legacy 1 vs 1 games.

This Infect deck aims to quickly assemble a deadly combination of pump spells and evasive creatures to deal 10 poison counters to the opponent. By utilizing low-cost creatures like Glistener Elf and Blighted Agent alongside powerful instant spells like Berserk and Become Immense, the deck can easily overwhelm opponents before they have a chance to react. The deck also includes efficient disruption in the form of counterspells like Daze and Force of Will to protect its infect creatures and ensure victory.

The main focus of this Grixis Aggro deck is to deploy threats quickly and disrupt the opponent's game plan. By utilizing efficient creatures like Delver of Secrets and Gurmag Angler, along with disruptive spells like Force of Will and Stifle, the deck aims to apply pressure on the opponent while also controlling the board. The deck also includes versatile spells like Brainstorm and Lightning Bolt to help maintain card advantage and deal with opposing threats. The mana base supports the deck's aggressive strategy by including fetch lands and a mix of dual lands to enable consistent casting of spells.

The central theme of this deck is to aggressively control the game using a combination of efficient creatures, disruptive spells, and powerful planeswalkers. By incorporating a mix of disruptive cards like Hymn to Tourach and Abrupt Decay alongside versatile threats like Tarmogoyf and Delver of Secrets, the deck aims to apply early pressure while disrupting the opponent's game plan. Additionally, the deck utilizes cheap interaction spells like Daze and Force of Will to protect its threats and prevent the opponent from stabilizing. Land destruction with Wasteland further adds to the deck's disruptive capabilities.

The main focus of this Legacy Merfolk deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive strategy. By utilizing creatures with powerful tribal synergies like Lord of Atlantis and Master of the Pearl Trident, as well as disruptive spells like Daze and Force of Will, the deck aims to establish board presence quickly and protect its key threats. Cards like True-Name Nemesis and Chalice of the Void further solidify the deck's game plan by providing difficult-to-answer threats and disruptive elements. The mana base is designed to support the deck's tempo strategy, allowing for consistent deployment of threats and disruption.

The main focus of this UR aggro deck is to quickly and aggressively deal damage to the opponent through efficient burn spells and aggressive creatures like Delver of Secrets, Monastery Swiftspear, and Stormchaser Mage. The deck aims to apply pressure early on, using cards like Lightning Bolt, Chain Lightning, and Price of Progress to control the board and finish off the opponent. With a low mana curve and plenty of card draw and counterspells, the deck can maintain its aggression while keeping the opponent on the back foot.

The main concept of this Grixis Aggro deck is to quickly disrupt the opponent's mana base with cards like Wasteland and Daze while applying pressure with efficient threats like Delver of Secrets, Young Pyromancer, and Gurmag Angler. The deck aims to control the game tempo with counterspells like Force of Will and Spell Pierce, while gaining card advantage with cantrips like Brainstorm and Ponder. Additionally, utilizing cards like Thought Scour and Gitaxian Probe helps to fuel graveyard synergies and provide information about the opponent's hand. Overall, this deck focuses on aggressive disruption and efficient threats to outpace the opponent.

The main concept of this deck is to control the game through counterspells and removal, while also using card draw and deck manipulation to ensure consistency. The deck utilizes a combination of powerful planeswalkers, such as Jace, the Mind Sculptor, and efficient creatures like Snapcaster Mage to maintain board presence and generate card advantage. The inclusion of Terminus as a board wipe option and Entreat the Angels as a win condition adds flexibility to the deck's game plan. The mana base is carefully constructed to support the deck's color requirements and maximize its potential.

This deck focuses on utilizing Counterbalance and Sensei's Divining Top to control the opponent's spells, while also running a suite of removal and card draw spells to answer threats and dig for key pieces. The deck aims to stall out the game until it can establish a dominant board presence with cards like Monastery Mentor and Jace, the Mind Sculptor. By leveraging card advantage and disruption, the deck looks to control the pace of the game and outvalue the opponent to secure a win.

The deck focuses on utilizing powerful creatures like Elesh Norn, Griselbrand, and Iona, by using cards like Careful Study, Exhume, Reanimate, and Entomb to bring them back from the graveyard and onto the battlefield quickly. It also includes disruptive elements like Thoughtseize, Daze, and Force of Will to protect the combo and disrupt opponents' strategies. The deck aims to quickly overwhelm opponents with large creatures and disrupt their game plan, ultimately aiming to win the game through a powerful reanimation combo.
